alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 6:20PM EDT until June 08 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL HARNETT...LEE...SOUTHWESTERN WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 619 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Cary to 9 miles northeast of Sanford to 7 miles west of Lillington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cary, Sanford, Lillington, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs, Coats and Broadway. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
